modules.description: Provides functions to access various system time sources, including real time since the Epoch, monotonic time, process and thread CPU time, and system uptime. Works with the `t` type to represent time values from different clocks. Used to measure elapsed time in applications requiring precise timing, such as performance monitoring or event scheduling.

Provides high-resolution time measurement using POSIX clock functions, including getting the current time, calculating time differences, and converting time values to human-readable formats. Operates on timestamps represented as tuples of seconds and nanoseconds. Used for precise timing in system-level applications such as performance monitoring and real-time data processing.

provides access to multiple system time sources through the `t` type, enabling precise time measurement across real, monotonic, process, thread, and system clocks. It supports operations like retrieving current time, calculating intervals, and tracking elapsed time with high accuracy. Applications can use it to monitor performance, synchronize events, or manage timeouts. For example, it can measure the duration of a function call or track system uptime over time.
